content.question: The function <math alttext="g of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> models the number of books sold in a store on day <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of days after January 1, 2020. Which of the following is the best interpretation of the statement <math alttext="g prime of 7 equals negative 11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>g</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mpadded></math> ?

choices.label: On January 8, 2020, approximately <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> books were sold.
On January 8, 2020, the number of books sold was decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> books per day.

On January 8, 2020, the rate at which books were sold was decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> books per day per day.

From January 1, 2020, to January 8, 2020, the number of books sold was decreasing at an average rate of <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> books per day.

content.answer: On January 8, 2020, the number of books sold was decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> books per day.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
